recipeBook.title: The Classic Ham Sandwich
recipeBook.shortDescription: Nothing beats the class ham sandwich from when you were a kid
recipeBook.ingredients: ham, your cheese (I prefer pepper jack), bread, other condiments like mayo or spicy mustard
instructions: Get two slices of bread.
Put a slice of ham then a slice of cheese, then ham, then cheese on one slice of bread.
On the other slice of bread put your condiments, for example I like spicy brown mustard.
Finally put the slice of bread with the condiments on the slice of bread with the ham and cheese. Now take that first bite and enjoy!
recipeBook.author: Andrew

recipeBook.title: Colombian Caldo
recipeBook.shortDescription: A simple, typical Colombian soup, normally eaten with a Colombian arepa.
recipeBook.ingredients: water, green onion, potatoes, milk, egg
instructions: Fill a pot based on the number of bowls you're going to serve divided by two. So if you're serving two people that will be one bowl of water. And begin cooking the water on medium high heat so that it boils.
Cut the potatoes into thin 1/2 inch slices and begin boiling them. 1-2 potatoes per 2 people.
Chop the white portion of the green onion into very fine pieces, and put it into the pot along with the potatoes.
After the potatoes are finished cooking add the same amount of milk as you did water. So you soup will be half water half milk.
Then add one egg per person into the boiling soup, so that the egg cooks quickly before breaking apart.
Serve into bowls ensuring that each person receives one egg and some potatoes.
recipeBook.author: Andrew
